title: Hardware Series A fundraising metrics benchmarks
summary: Series A hardware benchmarks focus on production capability, unit economics, and customer traction. Investors compare your metrics against hardware industry standards and successful hardware companies. These benchmarks demonstrate manufacturing maturity and commercial viability. Pitchchat keeps fundraising metrics investor-ready in one room.

metrics.label: Annual Revenue
metrics.note: Meaningful revenue demonstrating production and sales capability. Revenue quality (margin, repeatability) matters as much as growth.

metrics.label: Revenue Growth Rate
metrics.note: Strong growth trajectory while maintaining quality and margin. Hardware growth can be constrained by productionâ€”show path to scaling.

metrics.label: Gross Margin
metrics.note: Production gross margin on shipped products. Path to 50%+ at scale with specific improvement drivers identified.

metrics.label: First Pass Yield
metrics.note: Production FPY indicating manufacturing maturity. Consistent quality across production runs.

metrics.label: Units Shipped
metrics.note: Production volume proving manufacturing at scale. Unit quality and consistency matter as much as volume.

metrics.label: Customer Count
metrics.note: Meaningful customer base proving product-market fit. Segment diversity reduces concentration risk.

metrics.label: Net Promoter Score
metrics.note: High NPS indicates product satisfaction and supports organic growth critical for hardware.

metrics.label: Customer Return Rate
metrics.note: Low return rate indicates product quality and customer satisfaction. Include warranty costs.

metrics.label: Inventory Turns
metrics.note: Working capital efficiency measure. Higher turns indicate better inventory management.

metrics.label: CAC Payback
metrics.note: Customer acquisition cost payback period. Hardware often has longer payback but higher LTV.
